column5: Risk likelihood and impact considering existing controls implemented is used to determine the risk score. If the score is above the risk acceptance level then the risk must either be mitigated, avoided, transferred, shared or accepted. Risks can be accepted to pursue opportunities, but we typically only do this if there are good benefits and the cost of implementing controls is higher than the cost of the risk materialising.

column50: Our developer consultants are treated as internal employees, they are based onsite in the office and have company equipment. Therefore the risk is different as we have more control and they are subjected to our ISMS and security culture. There are still risks such as IP theft, malicious code injection and data breaches. Some of these risks are addressed contractually or through other technical controls. Overall, I'd say the risk level is medium.
